data.Title: Google ends Notes Search and Discover labs experiment
data.Description: Google is ending its experiment with Notes on Search. The feature, which was part of Google Search Labs, allowed users to add notes to search results. Google says that it has seen in its research that people want to hear from others like them and Notes was an exploration into that.

data.Title: Google knowledge panels with store ratings
data.Description: Google knowledge panels with store ratings (not local stars).

data.Title: Google tests renaming "short videos" to "quick takes"
data.Description: Google testing renaming "short videos" to "quick takes".

data.Title: Google Ads Japan renamed broad match to intent match
data.Description: Google Ads renamed broad match to intent match only in Japan.

data.Title: Google Ads query refinements for ad carousels
data.Description: Google testing query refinements for ad carousel placements.

data.Title: Google's Project Astra (a universal AI agent) could arrive by the end of the year
data.Description: Google's Project Astra (a universal AI agent) could arrive by the end of the year.

data.Title: New Google core update coming in weeks
data.Description: Google has announced that a new core update will be coming in the coming weeks. The last core update was the March 2024 core update, and many sites are still waiting since September 2023 to see helpful content recoveries.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles new chat feature no longer works
data.Description: Google Business Profiles' new chat feature is no longer working. Users are reporting that they are unable to start new chats. Google has not yet commented on the issue.

data.Title: Google site-level AGC artificially generated AI classification score
data.Description: Google may have a site-level AGC (auto-generated content) artificially generated AI classification score. This score could be used to identify and potentially penalize sites that are using AI to generate content.

data.Title: Publishers may be able exclude some of their content from Google Discover in the future
data.Description: Google may give publishers a way to exclude some of their content from Google Discover. This would give publishers more control over how their content is surfaced in Discover.

data.Title: Google Search testing back to AI Overview button
data.Description: Google Search is testing bringing back the AI Overview button. The button, which was previously removed, provides users with an AI-generated overview of a search result.

data.Title: Google Search testing highlighting words in blue in the search results and using light background colors
data.Description: Google Search is testing highlighting words in blue in the search results and using light background colors. This is likely part of Google's ongoing efforts to improve the visual presentation of search results.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles chat feature no longer lets you start new chats - make sure to download your chat history
data.Description: Google Business Profiles' chat feature is no longer allowing users to start new chats. Google recommends that users download their chat history before the feature is completely removed.

data.Title: Bing index is crucial in the future of SEO
data.Description: Bing's index is crucial in the future of SEO, not because of Bing the search engine, but because Bing's index now also powers ChatGPT (and thus, soon Apple's Siri), Meta AI, LinkedIn AI and Microsoft Copilot.

data.Title: Google Business Profile chat is gone and call history going away
data.Description: This is just a reminder that Google has discontinued Google Business Profile chat yesterday and call history is going away.
